title: 'A drunk woman is shameful': Why women face greater risks but receive less support for alcohol addiction
subhead: Although women as a whole drink less alcohol than men, they are physiologically more vulnerable to its toxicity. Yet these increased health risks are often met with silence, violence and delays in accessing care.

title: Epstein's African connections included presidents, heirs and recruiters

'Cancer is a political issue because public authorities have the power to prevent it, yet fail to do so'
subhead: Fleur Breteau, the founder of the Cancer Colère advocacy group, discusses the connection between public health and the agricultural model and France's lag in this area.

title: 'Donald Trump floods the political and media landscape, even in France, where domestic issues suddenly seem trivial'
subhead: In response to the provocations and upheavals brought about by the American president's policies, everyone is forced to take a stand – even in France, where the 2027 presidential election risks being profoundly shaken by international issues, writes Le Monde's journalist Solenn de Royer in her column.

title: 'Train Dreams' and 'Adolescence' win top prizes at Indie Spirit Awards
subhead: Period drama 'Train Dreams' won best feature Sunday while 'Adolescence' dominated the television categories. 'The Secret Agent' notched best international film, gathering momentum as Hollywood prepares for the Academy Awards.

title: How Jeffrey Epstein built the global network that protected him
subhead: The sexual predator, who came from a modest background, used his scheming and manipulation to open the doors to the global elite. His influence was such that many powerful figures continued to associate with him, even after his first conviction in 2008.

How the Ivorian president's niece acted as Epstein's go-between
subhead: The Epstein files reveal the close relationship between the late financier and Nina Keita, who introduced him to young women and local business leaders. The niece of Côte d'Ivoire's president, Alassane Ouattara, now holds a senior position in Abidjan.

title: Former French envoy to Moscow warns of a new US-Russia convergence
subhead: Confronted with hostility from both Russia and the US, Europe has been shaken by the disregard for international law, which underpins its very identity. French diplomat Pierre Lévy believes Europe must reassert its strengths.
